author: Special Correspondent
text:
A copy of the proclamation imposing President’s rule in Arunachal Pradesh and another revoking it were tabled in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday, which met briefly after President Pranab Mukherjee’s address to the joint sitting of the two Houses of Parliament. The government also tabled a copy of the Ordinance to amend the Enemy Property Act promulgated on January 7.

The members then condoled the demise of former Nepal Prime Minister, Sushil Koirala, former Speaker Balram Jakhar, former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mufti Mohammed Sayeed, and former members Noorul Huda and Shanti Devi.

Terming the attack on the Pathankot airbase a “cowardly act,” Speaker Sumitra Mahajan led Parliament in paying tributes to the security personnel killed in the incident.

Parliament also condoled the demise of personnel in the avalanche which struck an Army post in Siachen recently.
title: Arunachal ordinance tabled
